item.title: Gadwal collector hits the fields on bike to resolve land issues
item.description:
<![CDATA[Governance is not just about AC rooms and paperwork, and Gadwal district collector B.M. Santosh demonstrated this firsthand. Taking a hands-on approach, he visited farmers directly in their fields to understand their problems and show how effective administration works on the ground.
To address pending land records and Bhubharati applications, the collector personally rode a bike to villages, inspecting the fields where farmers are cultivating. He examined boundaries and records himself, rather...]]>
item.author: Gaddamidi Naveen

item.title: Retired Government Employees Urge Telangana Government to Resolve Pending Issues; New Association Committee Formed in Gadwal
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal: Leaders of the Government Retired Employees Association have urged the Telangana government to immediately address the long-pending issues faced by retired government employees. The demand was made by State President G. Damodar Reddy and General Secretary Chandrashekhar, along with other leaders, during a meeting held on Tuesday at the Association office located in the Housing Board area of Gadwal.
Addressing the gathering as chief guests, the leaders listened to the grievances of retir...]]>
item.author: The Hans India, Big Story, Tech News

item.title: Recount Demand Raised Over Alleged in Irregularities in Bingidoddi Sarpanch Election
item.description:
<![CDATA[Gadwal: A representation has been submitted to the Honâ€™ble State Election Commissioner, Hyderabad, seeking a recount of votes polled in the Sarpanch election of Bingidoddi village in Aija mandal, Alampur Assembly constituency, Jogulamba Gadwal district.
According to the complaint filed by U. Ramakrishna, a resident of Bingidoddi village and counting agent for Sarpanch candidate M. Narsimhulu, polling for the Gram Panchayat Sarpanch election was conducted on Sunday, December 14, 2025. He stated ...]]>
